answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Increased nocturnal urination could be due to excess liquid intake just before going to sleep, diabetes mellitus or diabetes insipidus, BPH and due to infection in the urinary tract.Are you having any medical conditions for which you are taking medicines? Certain diuretics could also cause this.I would suggest that you get a DRE of the prostrate done by a urologist, to rule out infection and BPH. A blood sugar test would also be required to rule out other possibilities.Hope this information helps.Take care

question: I am in advanced years and have sufferred from Proststitis for the last 15 years.I have had to get up during the night 1-3 times and have learnt to live with this.However,once or twice over the past week or so,I have had to get up 5-6 times,even though this is not the result of excess liquid intake,I take TAMSULOSIN HYDROCHLORIDE and DUTASTERIDE tablets daily.I don't know if it of any relevance,but I have no problem in getting an erection,although no semen.I am also circumcised.I wonder if anyone else has had similar experience?
title: Rate of urination
